author: Deleted User
content: on reddit when EIP1559 came up in discussions the top reply would go on to explain how first price auctions were ineffecient and that was a big motivation for having an algorithm choose the fee people pay instead. Maybe they were right

author: Deleted User
content: In the end it probably doesent matter because ETH largely has a monopoly so even if fee market is slightly borked it will be fine

author: timbeiko
content: While it's not strictly on topic, that is actually pretty interesting, thanks for sharing! Guess Google needs to bring in more $$$. FPAs are inefficient: if the bids are 1, 2, 5, then it's much more efficient to charge 2 (or 2.0001) to the winner than 5. The main problem w/ doing them on Ethereum is we don't have a trustless way of ordering the bids (e.g. if we do a 2nd Price Auction, miners will just put a bid > the top bid to bump the "true" first place to second place and charge that).
